text: Binyamin "Fuad" Ben-Eliezer (, ; 12 February 1936 â€“ 28 August 2016) was an Iraqi-born Israeli Labor-Alignment politician and general. He was a member of the Knesset between 1984 and 2014.Raleb Majadla Replaces Ben Eliezer in Knesset Israel National News, 14 December 2014 From 1999 until 2001, Ben- Eliezer was Deputy Prime Minister. From 2002 until 2003, he was the Opposition Leader. In 2014, Ben-Eliezer ran for President of Israel to replace Shimon Peres, however he withdrew after people accused him of corruption. Ben-Eliezer died on 28 August 2016 at a hospital in Tel Aviv from kidney disease, aged 80.Former Israeli Defense Minister Binyamin Fuad Ben-Eliezer Dies at Age 80 ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Israeli opposition leaders Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:Israeli generals Category:Politicians from Tel Aviv
title: Binyamin Ben-Eliezer
